metadata.title: CVE-2022-42252 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
If Apache Tomcat 8.5.0 to 8.5.82, 9.0.0-M1 to 9.0.67, 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.26or 10.1.0-M1 to 10.1.0 was configured to ignore invalid HTTP headers viasetting rejectIllegalHeader to false (the default for 8.5.x only), Tomcatdid not reject a request containing an invalid Content-Length header makinga request smuggling attack possible if Tomcat was located behind a reverseproxy that also failed to reject the request with the invalid header.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42252` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtomcat9-embed-java - 9.0.58-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
libtomcat9-java - 9.0.58-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
tomcat9 - 9.0.58-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
tomcat9-admin - 9.0.58-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
tomcat9-common - 9.0.58-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
tomcat9-examples - 9.0.58-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
tomcat9-user - 9.0.58-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat9 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.0.58-1ubuntu0.1+esm1').
